    • createSinglePlayerGame

      public void createSinglePlayerGame​(java.lang.String nickName)
      Create a single player game and the player, assign the player his turn number and let him choose the leaders
      Parameters:
      nickName - the nick of the player

    • continueStart

      public void continueStart()
      After createSinglePlayerGame(String) create the update message and send it to the player. Then terminate the initialization phase.

    • createMultiplayerGame

      public void createMultiplayerGame​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> players)
      Create a multiplayer game and the players, assign all the player the respective turn number and let him choose the leaders, then he receive the update message of all the other player to update the first leader and resources choice
      Parameters:
      players - the list of the nicks' players

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      If the player still has to choose where to put some resources, send back in info message beacuse the turn cannot be ended right now. Otherwise send an end confirmation message (that causes the next player to become current) and send all the updates of the things that has been done during the turn.

    • buyProdCardAction

      public void buyProdCardAction​(BuyProductionMessage buyProdMsg)
      Let the currentPlayer buy the single production card specified by the message.
      • It checks if the selected card is available for purchase, if not it throws a CARD_NOT_AVAILABLE;
      • If the stack chosen is not suited for that card accordingly to the rules implemented by the model, send WRONG_STACK_CHOICE or WRONG_LEVEL_REQUEST;
      • If the payment foreseen by the player is not adequate for the card, send a BAD_PAYMENT_REQUEST;
      • Otherwise: ACK.
      Related: MessageID
      Parameters:
      buyProdMsg - the message that carries all the information about: card, payment, production stack.

    • activateProdAction

      public void activateProdAction​(ProduceMessage produce)
      Let the player play the produce phase accordingly to the produce message's content (see ProduceMessage).

    • buyFromMarAction

      public void buyFromMarAction​(BuyMarketMessage buyMark)
      Invoke buyFromMarket() method in ProPlayer checking the player choice's correctness.

      If everything is fine, calls update() in order to generate a MessageID.CHOOSE_PLACEMENTS_IN_STORAGE and ask the player where to store the resources bought, otherwise generate various error messages.

    • organizeResourceAction

      public void organizeResourceAction​(StoreResourcesMessage message)
      Let the player choose where to store the resources or even discard them accordingly to the message's content (see StoreResourcesMessage).
      Parameters:
      message -

    • rearrangeWarehouse

      public void rearrangeWarehouse​(StoreResourcesMessage msg)
      Rearrange all the resources in the player's warehouse removing everything currently present and replacing them in the correct shelves as indicated by the msg. It doesn't check if the message is well formed or is exhaustive on how to refurnish the warehouse.
      Parameters:
      msg - has to contain all the resources previously held by the player with the new arrangement

    • chooseLeaderCards

      public void chooseLeaderCards​(java.lang.String ids, java.lang.String nick)
      Register the leader that a player choose in model
      Parameters:
      ids - IDs of the leaders
      nick - the player that has made the choice

    • activateLeader

      public void activateLeader​(LeaderCard leaderCard)
      Active a leader
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - the card to be activated.

    • discardLeader

      public void discardLeader​(java.lang.String s)
      Let the player discard a leader.

    • addResources

      public void addResources​(BiElement<Resource,​Storage> element, java.lang.Integer qty)
      If element is already contained in addedResources, then it increments its presence by 1. Otherwise, it add the element to the map as a new occurrence with is value set at 1.

    • removeResources

      public void removeResources​(BiElement<Resource,​Storage> element, java.lang.Integer qty)
      If element is already contained in addedResources, then it decrements its presence by qty. In order to do this, it increments the presence in removedResources map which is specific for this purpose. Otherwise, it add the element to the map as a new occurrence with is value set at qty.

    • initEndPhase

      public void initEndPhase​(int playerTriggerID)
      Start the last phase of the game by letting the others players make their last turn
      Parameters:
      playerTriggerID - player that has trigger the win action

    • update

      public void update​(MessageID messageID)
      Send the message to the respective remoteview using the right parameter for every message
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<MessageID>
      Parameters:
      messageID - the message ID of the message to send
